result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley N Bachmeier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution ($325.96) payable to PayPal and to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Courts costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Criminal Thinking or Financial Management Counseling.
No contact with the victim Jennifer L. listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Not to use a credit card without the permission of Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

timeConds.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 33 days sentence credit.
Balance to be served through Day Report Center.
Defendant to be release to Day Report Center forthwith.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 258 days sentence credit.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Any outstanding cost/surcharges are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Any outstanding restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/surcharges.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: October 13, 2015 Sentencing Hearing on Revocation heard by Judge Dreyfus, filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter.
Probation revoked, sentence imposed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ashley N Bachmeier in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  33 Months.
Initial Confinement:  15 Months.
Extended Supervision:  18 Months.
258 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

All outstanding restitution and costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Outstanding restitution to be paid before costs/surcharges.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to Taycheedah - FORTHWITH.

Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ashley N Bachmeier in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.   

Defendant pleads Guilty.
Court finds the defendant Guilty.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
Sentence Withheld

Term of Probation:   2 Years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Criminal Thinking or Financial Management Counseling
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  the victim (Jennifer L.) listed in the criminal complaint.
Not to use a credit card without the permission of your agent
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $325.96  (to be paid to PayPal - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COURT COSTS:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $250 
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
33 Days Credit
Balance to be served through the Day Report Program.
Defendant to be released to the Day Report Program - FORTHWITH.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
